chart.title: Sex ratio by age
chart.subtitle: The sex ratio is measured as the number of men per 100 women. This is shown across various age groups: from newborns to 100-year-olds.

Sex ratio - Sex: all - Age: 100+ - Varia.descriptionShort: The number of male individuals per 100 female individuals, at age 100+.
Sex ratio - Sex: all - Age: 100+ - Varia.citationShort: UN, World Population Prospects (2024) – processed by Our World in Data
Sex ratio - Sex: all - Age: 100+ - Varia.citationLong: UN, World Population Prospects (2024) – processed by Our World in Data. “Sex ratio, ages 100+ – UN WPP” [dataset]. United Nations, “World Population Prospects” [original data].

Sex ratio - Sex: all - Age: 0 - Variant:.titleLong: Sex ratio, at birth - UN WPP
Sex ratio - Sex: all - Age: 0 - Variant:.descriptionShort: The number of male births per 100 female births. Biological birth ratios are slightly male-biased, with an expected ratio of 105 male births per 100 female births.
